gobblin.data.management.trash

Class TestTrash

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.data.management.trash.Trash
      • gobblin.data.management.trash.ProxiedTrash
        • gobblin.data.management.trash.MockTrash
          • gobblin.data.management.trash.TestTrash
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GobblinProxiedTrash, GobblinTrash

    public class TestTrash
extends MockTrash
    Implementation of ProxiedTrash to use for testing. All operations in this implementation are noop, but user can get all delete operations executed using #getDeleteOperations. This implementation does not use the file system at all, so user can use a minimally mocked file system.

    This class optionally support simulating file system delay with an internal clock. The clock does not advance by itself, allowing programmers fine testing over a file system with delay.

    • Method Detail

      • propertiesForTestTrash

        public static Properties propertiesForTestTrash()

      • simulateDelay

        public static void simulateDelay(Properties properties,
                                 long delay)
        Mutates properties so that creating a TestTrash with this properties object will simulate delay in the filesystem.

        When simulating delay, any operation related to the filesystem will initially block indefinitely. The test trash uses an internal clock that must be advanced by the user (it does not advance by itself). Operations are blocked for a specified number of ticks in the clock. To tick, the user must call the tick() method.

        For example, if delay is 2: * User calls testTrash.moveToTrash(new Path("/")) -> call blocks indefinitely, nothing added to delete operations list. * User calls testTrash.tick() -> call still blocked. * User calls testTrash.tick() -> moveToTrash call returns, operation added to delete operations list.

        Parameters:
        properties - Properties used for building a test trash.
        delay - All calls to TestTrash involving file system will simulate a delay of this many ticks.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Advance the internal clock by one tick. The call will block until all appropriate threads finish adding their TestTrash.DeleteOperations to the list.
